subject_terms_3: are stated on the upper left hand side of the chart. The words ""By Joseph Huddart"" are displayed in all three sections of the chart. The title of the top section at the right hand side of the chart states ""Plan of Rat Island"". The title of the bottom section at the right hand side of the chart states ""Plan of Poolo Bay"". At the bottom of the chart East India Company
creator_2: Captain Joseph Huddart Laurie & Whittle Captain Joseph Huddart
object_work_type: aquatints (prints) marine charts navigation charts nautical charts
physical_appearance: "This marine chart is rectangular in shape and its perimeter is marked by a black line. The chart is divided into three sections, with one part occupying the left half while the right side is halved into two smaller areas. There are two different sets of scales used in this map, with 1 : 5 Nautical miles being used for the larger section and 1 : 1 Nautical mile for both the smaller sections. The title, ""A Chart of the West Coast of Sumatra"" This is a chart of the West coast of Sumatra.  It also has a plan of Poolo Bay, and that of Rat Island. These have been charted by Joseph Huddart.
sgcool_label_text: NA This chart of the southwestern coast of Sumatra was published by Laurie & Whittle, a commercial publisher of sea charts in the late eighteenth and early nineteeth centuries. Depicting the British East India Company (EIC) harbour of Bencoolen, the chart was based on the navigational work of Captain Joseph Huddart, hydrographer for the EIC.
creator_1: Huddart, Joseph, 1741 - 1816 Laurie & Whittle Huddart, Joseph, 1741-1816
